template&lt; class R, class T, class U &gt;
concept equivalence_relation = std::relation&lt;R, T, U&gt;;
}}
{{dcl end}}

The concept {{tt|equivalence_relation&lt;R, T, U&gt;}} specifies that the {{lconcept|relation}} {{tt|R}} imposes an {{enwiki|equivalence relation}} on its arguments.

===Semantic requirements===
A relation {{tt|r}} is an equivalence relation if
* it is reflexive: for all {{tt|x}}, {{tt|r(x, x)}} is {{c|true}};
* it is symmetric: for all {{tt|a}} and {{tt|b}}, {{tt|r(a, b)}} is {{c|true}} if and only if {{tt|r(b, a)}} is {{c|true}};
* it is transitive: {{tt|r(a, b) &amp;&amp; r(b, c)}} implies {{tt|r(a, c)}}.

===Notes===
The distinction between {{lconcept|relation}} and {{tt|equivalence_relation}} is purely semantic.
